docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IT was noon and time to feed her infant son, Audwyn. Noelle O'Connor, an assistant in the Asian art department at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, put down her research, closed the office door, unbuttoned her blouse and began nursing her 3-month-old baby, who accompanies her to work.
